channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Meta Learning for Efficient Fine-Tuning of Large Language Models
item.description: The research investigates the application of meta-learning strategies to enhance the adaptability and performance of LLMs with limited computational resources.

item.title: Towards Learning Abductive Reasoning using VSA Distributed Representations
item.description: We introduce the Abductive Rule Learner with Context-awareness (ARLC), a model that solves abstract reasoning tasks based on Learn-VRF.

item.title: SeaKR: Self-aware Knowledge Retrieval for Adaptive Retrieval Augmented Generation
item.description: This paper introduces Self-aware Knowledge Retrieval (SeaKR), a novel adaptive RAG model that extracts self-aware uncertainty of LLMs from their internal states.

item.title: Learning Pareto Set for Multi-Objective Continuous Robot Control
item.description: For a control problem with multiple conflicting objectives, there exists a set of Pareto-optimal policies called the Pareto set instead of a single optimal policy.

item.title: DEX-TTS: Diffusion-based EXpressive Text-to-Speech with Style Modeling on Time Variability
item.description: Expressive Text-to-Speech (TTS) using reference speech has been studied extensively to synthesize natural speech, but there are limitations to obtaining well-represented styles and improving model generalization ability.

item.title: CELLO: Causal Evaluation of Large Vision-Language Models
item.description: Previous work typically focuses on commonsense causality between events and/or actions, which is insufficient for applications like embodied agents and lacks the explicitly defined causal graphs required for formal causal reasoning.

item.title: Suri: Multi-constraint Instruction Following for Long-form Text Generation
item.description: Existing research on instruction following largely focuses on tasks with simple instructions and short responses.

item.title: SSP: Self-Supervised Prompting for Cross-Lingual Transfer to Low-Resource Languages using Large Language Models
item.description: We investigate their effectiveness for NLP tasks in low-resource languages (LRLs), especially in the setting of zero-labelled cross-lingual transfer (0-CLT), where no labelled training data for the target language is available -- however training data from one or more related medium-resource languages (MRLs) is utilized, alongside the available unlabeled test data for a target language.

item.title: SimpleFusion: A Simple Fusion Framework for Infrared and Visible Images
item.description: Integrating visible and infrared images into one high-quality image, also known as visible and infrared image fusion, is a challenging yet critical task for many downstream vision tasks.

item.title: Temporally Multi-Scale Sparse Self-Attention for Physical Activity Data Imputation
item.description: Wearable sensors enable health researchers to continuously collect data pertaining to the physiological state of individuals in real-world settings.

item.title: HUWSOD: Holistic Self-training for Unified Weakly Supervised Object Detection
item.description: Most WSOD methods rely on traditional object proposals to generate candidate regions and are confronted with unstable training, which easily gets stuck in a poor local optimum.

item.title: Read Anywhere Pointed: Layout-aware GUI Screen Reading with Tree-of-Lens Grounding
item.description: In this paper, we propose a Tree-of-Lens (ToL) agent, utilizing a novel ToL grounding mechanism, to address the SPR task.

item.title: Looking 3D: Anomaly Detection with 2D-3D Alignment
item.description: Automatic anomaly detection based on visual cues holds practical significance in various domains, such as manufacturing and product quality assessment.

item.title: From Biased Selective Labels to Pseudo-Labels: An Expectation-Maximization Framework for Learning from Biased Decisions
item.description: Inspired by causal models of selective labels, we propose Disparate Censorship Expectation-Maximization (DCEM), an algorithm for learning in the presence of disparate censorship.

item.title: Dysca: A Dynamic and Scalable Benchmark for Evaluating Perception Ability of LVLMs
item.description: Besides, these benchmarks merely focus on evaluating LVLMs on the realistic style images and clean scenarios, leaving the multi-stylized images and noisy scenarios unexplored.

item.title: SALVe: Semantic Alignment Verification for Floorplan Reconstruction from Sparse Panoramas
item.description: Once the room poses are computed, room layouts are inferred using HorizonNet, and the floorplan is constructed by stitching the most confident layout boundaries.

item.title: STBench: Assessing the Ability of Large Language Models in Spatio-Temporal Analysis
item.description: The rapid evolution of large language models (LLMs) holds promise for reforming the methodology of spatio-temporal data mining.

item.title: EmPO: Theory-Driven Dataset Construction for Empathetic Response Generation through Preference Optimization
item.description: Empathetic response generation is a desirable aspect of conversational agents, crucial for facilitating engaging and emotionally intelligent multi-turn conversations between humans and machines.

item.title: Two-Pronged Human Evaluation of ChatGPT Self-Correction in Radiology Report Simplification
item.description: Radiology reports are highly technical documents aimed primarily at doctor-doctor communication.

item.title: Improving Weak-to-Strong Generalization with Reliability-Aware Alignment
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) are now rapidly advancing and surpassing human abilities on many natural language tasks.

item.title: Predicting the duration of traffic incidents for Sydney greater metropolitan area using machine learning methods
item.description: Our experimental results demonstrate that XGBoost and LightGBM outperform conventional models with XGBoost achieving the lowest RMSE of 33. 7 for predicting incident duration and highest classification F1 score of 0. 62 for a 30-minute duration threshold.

item.title: Correspondence-Free Non-Rigid Point Set Registration Using Unsupervised Clustering Analysis
item.description: This paper presents a novel non-rigid point set registration method that is inspired by unsupervised clustering analysis.

item.title: TabReD: A Benchmark of Tabular Machine Learning in-the-Wild
item.description: In this work, we examine existing tabular benchmarks and find two common characteristics of industry-grade tabular data that are underrepresented in the datasets available to the academic community.

item.title: Autoencoder based approach for the mitigation of spurious correlations
item.description: Deep neural networks (DNNs) have exhibited remarkable performance across various tasks, yet their susceptibility to spurious correlations poses a significant challenge for out-of-distribution (OOD) generalization.

item.title: Dimensions underlying the representational alignment of deep neural networks with humans
item.description: Applying this framework to humans and a DNN model of natural images revealed a low-dimensional DNN embedding of both visual and semantic dimensions.

item.title: The Remarkable Robustness of LLMs: Stages of Inference?
item.description: We find that deleting and swapping interventions retain 72-95\% of the original model's prediction accuracy without fine-tuning, whereas models with more layers exhibit more robustness.

item.title: CORE4D: A 4D Human-Object-Human Interaction Dataset for Collaborative Object REarrangement
item.description: With 1K human-object-human motion sequences captured in the real world, we enrich CORE4D by contributing an iterative collaboration retargeting strategy to augment motions to a variety of novel objects.

item.title: Learning Retrieval Augmentation for Personalized Dialogue Generation
item.description: Specifically, the proposed LAPDOG model consists of a story retriever and a dialogue generator.

item.title: BackMix: Mitigating Shortcut Learning in Echocardiography with Minimal Supervision
item.description: Neural networks can learn spurious correlations that lead to the correct prediction in a validation set, but generalise poorly because the predictions are right for the wrong reason.

item.title: Improving the Expressiveness of $K$-hop Message-Passing GNNs by Injecting Contextualized Substructure Information
item.description: Recently, there is a line of works aiming to enhance the expressive power of graph neural networks.

item.title: Statistical Test for Data Analysis Pipeline by Selective Inference
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel statistical test designed to assess the statistical significance of data analysis pipelines.

item.title: ReXTime: A Benchmark Suite for Reasoning-Across-Time in Videos
item.description: This form of reasoning, requiring advanced understanding of cause-and-effect relationships across video segments, poses significant challenges to even the frontier multimodal large language models.

item.title: Resolving Discrepancies in Compute-Optimal Scaling of Language Models
item.description: As a secondary result, we derive scaling laws for the optimal learning rate and batch size, finding that tuning the AdamW $\beta_2$ parameter is essential at lower batch sizes.

item.title: Efficient World Models with Context-Aware Tokenization
item.description: Scaling up deep Reinforcement Learning (RL) methods presents a significant challenge.

item.title: Federated Graph Semantic and Structural Learning
item.description: First, for node-level semantics, we find that contrasting nodes from distinct classes is beneficial to provide a well-performing discrimination.

item.title: Retain, Blend, and Exchange: A Quality-aware Spatial-Stereo Fusion Approach for Event Stream Recognition
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel dual-stream framework for event stream-based pattern recognition via differentiated fusion, termed EFV++.

item.title: Structural Attention: Rethinking Transformer for Unpaired Medical Image Synthesis
item.description: To address this, we introduce UNet Structured Transformer (UNest), a novel architecture incorporating structural inductive biases for unpaired medical image synthesis.

item.title: Improving Taxonomic Image-based Out-of-distribution Detection With DNA Barcodes
item.description: Image-based species identification could help scaling biodiversity monitoring to a global scale.

item.title: Adaptive Stochastic Weight Averaging
item.description: Despite its potential benefits, maintaining a running average of parameters can hinder generalization, as an underlying running model begins to overfit.

item.title: LiveBench: A Challenging, Contamination-Free LLM Benchmark
item.description: In this work, we introduce a new benchmark for LLMs designed to be immune to both test set contamination and the pitfalls of LLM judging and human crowdsourcing.

item.title: FedMLP: Federated Multi-Label Medical Image Classification under Task Heterogeneity
item.description: Experiments on two publicly-available medical datasets validate the superiority of FedMLP against the state-of-the-art both federated semi-supervised and noisy label learning approaches under task heterogeneity.

item.title: Human-Aware Vision-and-Language Navigation: Bridging Simulation to Reality with Dynamic Human Interactions
item.description: Vision-and-Language Navigation (VLN) aims to develop embodied agents that navigate based on human instructions.

item.title: AutoPureData: Automated Filtering of Web Data for LLM Fine-tuning
item.description: Up-to-date and reliable Large Language Models (LLMs) are consistently sought after.

item.title: Semi-adaptive Synergetic Two-way Pseudoinverse Learning System
item.description: The whole system is trained using a non-gradient descent learning algorithm.

item.title: What Is Missing In Homophily? Disentangling Graph Homophily For Graph Neural Networks
item.description: Then, a crucial question arises: What is missing in our current understanding of homophily?

item.title: Evidential Concept Embedding Models: Towards Reliable Concept Explanations for Skin Disease Diagnosis
item.description: With the proposed methods, we can enhance concept explanations' reliability for both supervised and label-efficient settings.

item.title: Bidirectional-Reachable Hierarchical Reinforcement Learning with Mutually Responsive Policies
item.description: Hierarchical reinforcement learning (HRL) addresses complex long-horizon tasks by skillfully decomposing them into subgoals.

item.title: Selective Prompting Tuning for Personalized Conversations with LLMs
item.description: To alleviate those issues, we propose \textbf{S}elective \textbf{P}rompt \textbf{T}uning (SPT), which softly prompts LLMs for personalized conversations in a selective way.

item.title: A Closer Look into Mixture-of-Experts in Large Language Models
item.description: Mixture-of-experts (MoE) is gaining increasing attention due to its unique properties and remarkable performance, especially for language tasks.

item.title: BiTrack: Bidirectional Offline 3D Multi-Object Tracking Using Camera-LiDAR Data
item.description: Compared with real-time multi-object tracking (MOT), offline multi-object tracking (OMOT) has the advantages to perform 2D-3D detection fusion, erroneous link correction, and full track optimization but has to deal with the challenges from bounding box misalignment and track evaluation, editing, and refinement.
